Comment: Yes and no, I'm a Canadian. His rhetoric was hostile to Trump and the US; but he has an entire policy plan and platform. This is a huge factor. Trump helped the Liberals; but the Conservatives had no platform except Trudeau bad. Which didn't inspire confidence alongside their Trump-light talking points. The vote looks close; but this was a fairly resounding rebuke of Trump style populism.   Typically Americans don't understand our politics; but the greatest enemy to the incumbent is time. The most important factor in the Conservatives popularity is Liberal fatigue which is why Pp was just low-effort coasting. Nearly without exception we switch parties every 6-8 years as a natural part of our political ecosystem and that was reflected in the early polling. It has a lot less to do with Trudeau actually being incompetent than people think. Disrupting this and awarding a 4th Liberal term in a row is historic.

Comment: I doubt very much Carney's goal is to stop trade with America.    But, as you say, this is not a stupid man we've elected. You can be sure a lot of eggs are going to be removed from the giant US basket and placed in a lot of other baskets.   China, for example, is already buying our crude at a record clip over the last 2 months. Hopefully this will continue and we get to a point where we no longer sell to the US at such a deep discount.   Ironically, that result would get rid of the trade surplus with America and there would be no reason to tariff other items coming from Canada.   China got it right after Trump 1.0 by diversifying trade because of the 2018 tariffs. We should have taken our cue from them at that time and done the same. Better late than never, though
